episode_title: 815 - The One With The Birthing Video

content.description: Central Perk. Rachel is getting a cup of coffee as Joey and Phoebe enter and sit down.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Hey, Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Hey, Happy Valentine’s Day!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you, too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, so, uh, how’s it going living over at Ross’?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s good. Except he makes us watch the Discovery Channel all day long. Did you know that something really boring happened to someone really ugly in the Middle Ages? (to the waitress handing her a cup of coffee) Oh, thank you. I’ll see you guys later.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bye.
(Rachel exits with coffee)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There’s one lucky to-go cup of coffee.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Honey, I wish you would get over her. I hate seeing you like this. Is there anything I can do for you? Do you want to look down my top?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks. But maybe later.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, Gunther, can I get a scone?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: You want anything?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know what I want? I want a lot of things! I want to be with the woman I love on Valentine’s Day! And I want her to love me back! And I want just one moment of relief from the gut-wrenching pain of knowing that that’s never going to happen!

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: We have red bagels.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, okay.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s. Phoebe and Ross are sitting in the living room talking.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, how does Mona feel about you and Rachel living together?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I’m actually on my way to tell her right now. Yeah, she’s been away all week visiting her parents, but she’ll be cool. I mean, she’s been so supportive. She-she even got the baby a tiny T-shirt that says, ‘Fossils are my friends.’

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ugh. Come on, Mona, don’t kiss ass.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, I’m going to take off.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. Oh! Shoot! Oh shoot! Uh, Rachel wanted to see this tape!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s a video of my friend giving birth. Could you just bring it back to your apartment?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. (reading the label) ‘Candy and Cookie?’

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Candy’s the mother, Cookie’s the daughter. The father’s also Cookie. Why am I friends with these people?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, c’mere. I want to show you something in the bathroom.
content.parenthetical: entering with something behind her back

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, Monica, grow up!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, what’s behind your back?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing. Just something I want to get Phoebe’s opinion on for Valentine’s Day.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You don’t want my opinion?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not really.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, I’m your older brother, ask me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, big brother. (holds up two erm…revealing articles of clothing) Which of these do you think would make your little sister look hotter, so your best friend would want to do her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The red one.

content.description: Joey and…wait…just Joey’s. Joey is sitting at the counter eating a pizza.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey. Look, I know you’ve been really depressed lately, so I brought someone over to cheer you up. Right outside this door is a real, live, furry playmate.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I’m not sleeping with your friend Jane again.
(Phoebe goes into the hall and brings a dog inside!)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He-hee!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! A dog! Hi! Who, you got to admit, looks a lot like Jane.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is the happiest dog in the world. I borrowed him from my friend Wendy. Now, you can only keep him until he cheers you up. And he will cheer you up!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks so much, Pheebs! (to the dog) We are going to have so much fun, yes we are! (the dog sticks his head between Joey’s legs) Oh! Not that kind of fun.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s. Chandler enters with a bouquet of roses.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Happy Valentine’s!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! I’ll be right out. I’m slipping into something a little less comfortable, and a little more slutty.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ‘Candy and Cookie’. ‘Candy and Cookie?’ Monica got me porn?! Girl-on-girl porn?! She really must love me!! (Chandler runs over to the TV, puts the tape in, and sits down to enjoy some “porn”)
content.parenthetical: picking up a video from the table

content.text: (A woman on TV breaths hard)

content.speaker: Man on TV
content.text: Yeah, just relax.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I love you, St. Valentine.
(The woman groans, moans, grunts, and screams. Chandler’s eyes get huge!)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Woah, woah, that’s not pretty!

content.speaker: Man on TV
content.text: Now, push!

content.speaker: Woman on TV
content.text: Ow! Ow! Ooh! That hurts!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Worst porn ever! Worst porn ever! (Chandler starts to press buttons on the remote control, frantically.)

content.speaker: Woman on TV
content.text: Ohhh! Make it stop!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am trying!

content.description: Joey’s. Joey is playing fetch with the dog.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get the ball, ready? Get the ball, get the ball! (Joey pretends to throw it, but really doesn’t, and the dog goes running off.) Well, you’re cute, but you’re not too smart!
(The dog returns with a ball that looks exactly like the same one Joey has.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Did I just throw this?
content.parenthetical: looking at the ball the dog brought back

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I accidentally packed these with my stuff. (looks at the dog and gasps) Who is this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, that’s, uh, that’s Phoebe’s friend’s dog. I don’t know what his real name is, but I call him Mozzarella.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well, you are so cute! I wish I could play with you more, but I’ve got to go to work! I hope I stop talking like this before my marketing meeting, yes I do. Yes I do. (still talking like that) Bye-bye, Joey. Oh, I seriously can’t stop it. (exits)
content.parenthetical: talking with a higher voice, and puckered lips…kind of like you do to a baby or...well…a puppy…it’s hard to explain. Just use your imagination!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: C’mere. Hey. C’mere. That’s Rachel. She’s the one who used to live here. Might as well be honest with you—we love her. But we can’t have her. I really miss her. Well, hey, you understand, right? You’re a guy. (thinks about it and picks up the dog and looks) Well, you used to be.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s. Chandler is sitting on the couch staring at the tape on the coffee table with his eyes huge and his mouth wide open.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So what do you think? (referring to her outfit)
(Chandler glances up at Monica with his mouth still wide open and his eyes still huge)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ve still got it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why did you get me this?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s yelling…bleeding…dilating. Oh, the dilating…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is this the video of the baby being born? Sweetie, this is Phoebe’s. Why were you even watching it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I thought…maybe…you got me porn for Valentine’s Day.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, if you thought I was going to get you porn for Valentine’s Day… (pulls a video out of a basket) you were right! Apparently, it’s about a young girl who moves to the big city, you know, in search of stardom, but ends up having sex with a lot of guys! Yeah, it got four starts! (looks closer) Oh, wait a minute. Those aren’t stars. Anyway, you want to take a look?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m not really in a sexy mood right now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, remember the first time we saw Jaws ?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mm-hmm.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How long it took to go back in the water?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, we can’t let this tape wreck Valentine’s Day!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t know. You didn’t see it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Child-birth, it’s a natural thing! It’s beautiful.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, beautiful? Really? Beautiful? You think this is beautiful? (picks up the remote and presses a button, and he immediately makes a face that just looks like he’s going to throw up!)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh! Oh, my God! No wonder my mother hates me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See, honey, there’s—(puts his hand on her leg)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t touch me!

content.description: Central Perk. Ross is sitting on the couch reading a magazine as Mona enters.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! (they hug) So, how was Atlantic City?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: I brought you back a present.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha—? Oh, come on. You didn’t have to—saltwater taffy?! (Mona laughs) Thanks! This is interesting. You know, most people think this is made with sea water, but it’s actually made with, uh, salted fresh water. That’s not interesting.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: I think it’s interesting.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I do too! I missed you!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: I missed you, too! So, how was your week?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, it was good! It was good. Actually, the baby started kicking!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: How exciting!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! I know! It was. Oh… the only sad thing is I wasn’t around when it happened for the first time.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh no.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I’m missing out on all this other stuff, too. So, Joey suggested Rachel move in with me.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Yeah right!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Joey cracks me up! It’s like, ‘Yeah, why don’t you have your ex-wife move in with you? That wouldn’t be awkward at all!’ (she laughs again)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh…uh-huh.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Huh, could you imagine. I go away for a few days, and come back, and my boyfriend is living with some woman he got pregnant! (Mona laughs…yes…again!)
(Ross fake laughs, obviously not finding this funny, and he’s starting to panic, so he shoves the whole saltwater taffy he’s eating in his mouth)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: So, what’d you tell him?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just a second! (he fake laughs, but turns his head and starts to break down)

content.description: Central Perk. Ross and Phoebe are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How could you not tell Mona that Rachel is living with you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, she seemed to think it was such a crazy idea! Um, plus, she, uh, she got me taffy!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Taffy, really? I’ve never had any.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ever?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I think my mother was too busy planning her suicide to provide saltwater treats. (Ross hands her one) Thank you! So what, you’re just never going to tell her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, no, no, no, I will! I just want to butter her up, first! You know, I’m going to take her to an amazing Valentine’s dinner. Do all this romantic stuff, and then, just when she thinks I’m the best boyfriend in the world, then I’m going to tell her that my pregnant ex-girlfriend is living with me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: If I haven’t said it before: she’s a lucky, lucky lady! So, where are you going to—what the mother of crap is up with this stuff? (Referring to the taffy, which she’s been chewing this whole time.) Oh, God. Is it gum, is it food? What’s the deal? (she swallows it, finally) Oh, it’s nice! May I try a pink one?

content.description: Joey’s. Joey is laying on his recliner, depressed, and the dog is laying on the footrest.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, between her and me being friends, and her history with Ross, it just isn’t going to happen. It would be like you falling in love with a cat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, buddy. How’s my favorite dog, huh? How’s my favorite dog? (the dog doesn’t move) You’re subdued. (to Joey) Did you give him a beer?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Will you excuse us, we need to talk for a moment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, sure. Go ahead. (pause) Oh, me, right!
(Joey follows Phoebe into the kitchen)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He’s miserable! What happened to him?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nothing. We just talked about stuff.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What stuff?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rachel stuff.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh…Joey, you bummed him out! This was the happiest dog in the world, and he spends half a day with you, and look at him!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He’s breathing!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I’m going to take him back to Wendy’s.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, no, no! He’s fine! Look, look, look! (picks up the ball) Here’s your ball! Get your ball! Get your ball! (he throws the ball and it bounces right next to the dog) Get your ball! My God, what have I done to you, huh? I broke the dog! Pheebs, I broke the dog!

content.description: Ross and…Rachel’s…I guess I have to call it that now. Rachel is reading on the couch as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’m, uh, going to pick up Mona. What have you got going tonight?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’ve got big Valentine’s plans! I’ve got my Chinese food on the way, and the rest of your saltwater taffy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, it’s interesting! Most people think that’s made with seawater, when in fact—

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, we actually watched the documentary together.
(There is a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh! My Chinese food! Let me get my cash! (runs to her room to get her money)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mona? What are—hi! What are you doing here? I’m, um, supposed to pick you up!
content.parenthetical: opening the door to see Mona standing there

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Change of plans, I made you a special Valentine’s dinner! Surprise!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ayyyayyyy!
content.parenthetical: he makes some really weird noise hear that sounds kind of like…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hey, Mona!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hi! Hi. Hi, Rachel! (to Ross) What’s she doing here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I have no idea!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll be watching TV if anybody needs me. (exits to her room)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Seriously, what is she doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh…lately, she just likes hanging out here.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think she’s lonely.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Okay, but it’s Valentine’s Day!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Can’t we just ask her to go?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no. She’s way to emotional. And by emotional I mean crazy.
(Doorbell rings)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not here! That’s just my Chinese food!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh, my God! She has food delivered here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mm-hmm. She’s—she’s emotional, but, but ballsy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know what I’m going to do? I’m going to get in my sweats, and eat this in bed! (exits)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And you thought she was going to be in our way! So, why don’t you, uh, open the champagne, and I’ll be right back. I’ve got a surprise for you.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: You got another ex-wife back there?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Please start drinking! (exits)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m just going to grab the phone.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh, Rachel! Wait! Hey, I hope you don’t take this the wrong way, but, but, um… what are you doing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry! Do you need the phone?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: No, no. Listen, Ross is too nice to say anything, but this is his apartment, and, and, we gotta have some boundaries, so why don’t you go back to your place and give us some privacy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But, but, Mona, I live here.
content.parenthetical: as Ross enters with a present

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Happy Valentine’s Day! …Or something to remember me by.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s. Monica and Chandler are sitting on the couch still staring at the screen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How long has it been this time?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: 90 seconds.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s better. 90 seconds is a long time not to think about it…except all I did was think about it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, it haunts me? Up ‘til now, the worst thing I ever saw, was my father doing tequila shots off the naked houseboy. After this, I would gladly make that my screensaver!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, well, we have to get past this! Why don’t we get rid of the tape and pretend it never existed?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can do that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.
(Chandler takes the tape and sticks it under the chair cushion)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Now all we’ve got to do is get rid of this chair.
(Chandler crawls over to Monica and they move in to kiss, but they can’t do it and back up. They move in to kiss again, and kiss very awkwardly for a second, until someone knocks on the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, thank God!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I know!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come in!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! I’m so sorry to barge in on your Valentine’s, but I had to get away from all the yelling. Mona is dumping Ross.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, my God.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Poor Ross.
(Monica and Chandler both look at each other and run over to the window to watch the action in Ross’ apartment)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, great. We have to watch him do yoga in his underwear, but for this he closes the drapes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, you know that birthing tape you wanted to see? It’s here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, and we should warn you, before you watch it: don’t watch it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why? You saw it? Is it scary?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, let’s just say it’s ironic how footage of someone being born can make you want to kill yourself.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, now, wait. Now I’m all freaked out. Come on, you guys will watch it with me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, but I will leave a sweater that smells like me right next to you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: C’mon, seriously, you guys, you’re not going to make me watch this alone!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She’s right…of course not. Honey, get the tape.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This reminds me of a very specific part of the tape. (Chandler puts the tape in, and they all sit down) Okay, here we go.
content.parenthetical: with his arm all the way under the cushion, moving it around

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (watching the tape) Ooh, my! (Rachel jumps when the woman starts screaming) Woah! Why is that baby torturing that woman?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why have I seen this thing three times?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s…still beautiful.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh! It’s horrible!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know! I know, I’m so sorry for you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, my God!
(Monica and Rachel both cover their eyes)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait, you guys, look!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Did her ass explode?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, the baby’s out! Look, look!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, look at those little fingers and toes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And look how happy the mom is now!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh…Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, screw you guys, you don’t have to do it!

content.description: Central Perk. Ross is getting coffee as Joey comes from…God knows where! Some back area of Central Perk around the corner that we’ve never seen! Weeeiiirrrddd….

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, hey, man!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, what’s up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh…Mona just dumped me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, man, I’m sorry. Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, with everything that’s been going on lately, I haven’t exactly been the perfect boyfriend. You know, I, uh, I didn’t tell her I got Rachel pregnant. I gave her a key to my apartment, and then had the locks changed! And then I lied to her about Rachel moving in with me. In a way, I actually judge her for not breaking up with me sooner, you know?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Still, that really sucks, man. Especially on Valentine’s Day.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Wait a minute. What are you doing here? Joey Tribbiani without a date on Valentine’s Day? What’s going on, huh? Girl trouble?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sort of.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You don’t have to seem so happy about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, sorry. Well, look, maybe I can help you with it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I…I d—

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, whatever it is, I am sure it has happened to me. Y’know, actually once—once I got dumped during sex.
(Two girls sitting at a table next to them look up in disgust, and Ross and Joey move away)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anyway, so, uh, so what is it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Forget about it. It’s no big deal.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon! Joey! What is it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s nothing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, hey, it’s me. Why can’t you tell me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, uh…sit down. (they do) Um… there’s this woman that I like. A lot. But, uh…it can’t happen.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She’s not a Tribbiani?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I knew it. So, is she someone from work?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, uh, does she like you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sometimes I think maybe she could. But it doesn’t matter, because I can’t do anything about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, it’s complicated. She’s with this other guy. For a long time. Someone from work, too. And I could never do that to the guy, because we’re really good friends.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, uh, this guy, she used to go out with, is, uh… is he still in love with her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Um… is he a good guy?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, he’s the best.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Then talk to him! He might be fine with it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, it’s worth finding out. I mean, if you really like her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I do! So much! I can’t stop thinking about her! I can’t sleep, I—

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, Joey, you know what? You have to go for it. How often does this happen to you, huh? You owe it to yourself.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Here’s your warm milk.
content.parenthetical: placing a cup in front of Ross

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m going to…uh…I’m going to, um, put the bourbon in it at home.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anyway… seriously, uh…just…just talk to the guy, okay? And tell me how it goes. (walks towards the door until…)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s Rachel.
(Ross just stands in the doorway, for like a minute…Ahh! What’s going to happen next??!!! I can’t make it all the way through the Olympics!!!)

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s. Rachel is standing in front of the TV holding a video.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re going to have a baby, and you need to be prepared. Now, you’re going to make yourself watch the whole thing. Just do it! (Rachel puts the tape in the VCR)

content.speaker: Woman on TV
content.text: I came to the big city to become a star! I’ll do…anything to make that happen!

content.speaker: Man on TV
content.text: Anything?
(Music starts playing…yes…you know what kind of music…)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmm…maybe it starts with how she gets pregnant .
